text: But it doesn't work with predefined modules as "flexible column", right?
as in if the module was added to a page that contained a flexible column?
did a quick test and it looks like if you create a page with a flexible column and then add a module to it on the page editor. When you view dependents it does show it under the live pages:
Will also do it if you add that module at the template level to the flexible column area in the template

When I am in design manager, in inspector, when I click on "add", I choose "Colonne flexible" (flexible column). I thought It was a module. Maybe it's not(?). But I want to know where this element is used. Can I find this information anywhere?

Hello. I'm a UX Designer for a small company doing both designs and development for their new website. I was wondering if anyone knew a way to sync the custom modules from HubSpot into the *local* hubl server?

Your solution ask me to put a kind of sentinel in a flexible column to find all ones when I search this sentinel (that's right?). But I want to find where other developers of the portal used this element... :confused:
is probably what you are looking for

ahhh ok i see what you are saying. I dont believe there is a way to view dependents of standard HubSpot moudles like the flexible column. Might be something to add to the <#C26E7JT8V|ideas> channel. I'll post it in there and tag this msg thread.
So it's a standard HubSpot module. Ok. Thanks to you: I better understand now.

Yep, if you go into the "+ Add" dropdown on the right and view default modules, those are standard HS modules. Likewise, if you look at the tag "Structural Modules" there should be 3 that are also default ones
```
Module Group
Flexible Column
Horizontal Spacer
```
